# trimmed(start:end:duration:)

**Instance Method**

Edits the animation duration according to the specified time.

## Declaration

```swift
func trimmed(start: TimeInterval? = nil, end: TimeInterval? = nil, duration: TimeInterval? = nil) -> Self
```

## Parameters

- **start**: The time within the underlying duration to begin playback.
- **end**: The time within the underlying duration to end playback.
- **duration**: The amount of time that overrides the underlying duration.

## Return Value

A version of the animation shortened or lengthened according to the specified times.

## Discussion

If an argument property lies outside the underlying [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/duration], the animation plays back according to the characteristics of its [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/repeatMode].

## Timing the animation

- **speed**: A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.
- **delay**: An amount of time that elapses before the animation plays.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the source animation’s duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation stops.
